article_title: Aetna, CHI St. Luke's in spat over rates
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

og.description:
Scores of Aetna members in the Houston area could have to change hospitals as a result of a threatened split between the insurer and CHI St. Luke's Health.
The hospital system's participation in almost all Aetna plans will end as soon as Oct. 22 unless the two can reach an agreement. CHI St. Luke's contract with Aetna's Medicare Advantage program ends Dec. 31.
It's unclear how many patients could be affected. Aetna spokeswoman Anjanette Coplin said in an email the insurer is trying to determine how many of its members have sought treatment at CHI St. Luke's facilities in the last 12 months.
